title: Create three complete faction-specific HUDs with enhanced polish and mobile optimization

requirements.text: Create three completely separate faction HUD systems (HECU, Security, Resistance), each with its own complete interface design, tab structure, and layouts. Each faction should have distinct visual identity while maintaining all existing HUD functionality.

quotes: Make the tabs seperate and add faction specific huds like security tab for security, etc.

acceptanceCriteria: Three distinct faction HUD layouts exist with separate routing/view components
Each faction maintains all core tabs (Basics, Hazards, Medical, Tactical, Weapons, etc.)
Faction selection persists in settings and loads the correct HUD on app start
Visual identity is consistent throughout each faction's interface

requirements.text: Apply faction-specific color schemes consistently across all UI elements: HECU uses green, Security uses blue, and Resistance uses yellow-orange. Colors should affect borders, accents, progress bars, badges, buttons, and all interactive elements within each faction's HUD.

quotes: HECU should be green, security blue, and resistance yellow-orange

acceptanceCriteria: HECU HUD uses green color scheme throughout all components
Security HUD uses blue color scheme throughout all components
Resistance HUD uses yellow-orange color scheme throughout all components
Color theming applies to borders, progress bars, badges, buttons, and highlights

requirements.text: Implement faction-specific weapon arsenals with predefined weapon sets for each faction that appear automatically based on selected faction. Additionally, provide user customization capability to modify which weapons appear for each faction.

quotes: add faction specific guns as well

acceptanceCriteria: HECU faction displays military-grade weapons (MP5, SPAS-12, M4A1, explosives)
Security faction displays security equipment (9mm Pistol, MP5, shotgun, stun stick)
Resistance faction displays improvised/rebel weapons (Pulse Rifle, Crossbow, SMG, grenades)
Users can customize weapon lists per faction in settings
Weapon data persists per faction selection

requirements.text: Enhance the boot sequence with more realistic system initialization including sequential loading text, multiple initialization stages, glitch effects, and progressive system checks. Make the boot-up feel like a real computer system starting up.

quotes: more system initialization and more polish
More system initialization text, sequential loading, glitch effects for realism

acceptanceCriteria: Boot sequence displays multiple initialization stages with descriptive text
Systems load sequentially with visual progression indicators
Glitch effects appear during boot for added realism
Boot sequence includes faction-specific initialization messages
Audio accompanies boot sequence stages

requirements.text: Polish tab selection interactions with smooth transitions, better visual feedback, hover effects, and active state indicators. Make tab switching feel responsive and professional.

quotes: Polished tab transitions with visual feedback

acceptanceCriteria: Tab hover states show clear visual feedback
Active tab has distinct styling from inactive tabs
Tab transitions are smooth with CSS animations
Tab switching triggers appropriate UI sound effects
Keyboard navigation (1-9 keys) works with visual feedback

requirements.text: Implement comprehensive quality of life features including keyboard shortcuts for all major actions, tooltips on interactive elements, quick-switch between factions, saved user preferences, and auto-hide functionality for non-critical elements.

quotes: Quality of life features: keyboard shortcuts, tooltips, quick-switch between factions, saved preferences, auto-hide elements

acceptanceCriteria: Keyboard shortcuts work for faction switching (e.g., Ctrl+1/2/3)
Tooltips appear on hover for buttons, badges, and controls
User preferences persist across sessions (localStorage/settings)
Quick-faction switcher accessible from settings or keyboard
Auto-hide feature for secondary UI elements when inactive

requirements.text: Optimize all HUD layouts for mobile devices with semi-compact responsive design that is 100% friendly for small screens. Ensure all faction HUDs, tabs, panels, and controls are fully functional and readable on mobile viewports.

quotes: make everything user friendly and semi compact but make sure it is 100% friendly for small screens
Semi-compact design that's 100% friendly for small screens

acceptanceCriteria: All faction HUDs render correctly on mobile devices (320px+)
Touch targets are appropriately sized for mobile interaction
Text remains readable without zooming on small screens
Layouts adapt responsively without horizontal scrolling
Mobile-specific optimizations for tab navigation and panels

requirements.text: Add professional sectioning and layout organization with small visual details like dividers, section headers, subtle spacing adjustments, and grouped related elements. Make the interface feel polished and well-organized.

quotes: Add small details like sectioning, etc.
Small sectioning details for professional look

acceptanceCriteria: Panels use section headers to group related content
Visual dividers separate distinct sections within tabs
Related controls are grouped with appropriate spacing
Consistent padding and margins throughout interface
Professional visual hierarchy with clear information organization

requirements.text: Preserve all existing features including H.E.V Mark selection (Prototype through Mark V), Mark I glitch effects, Prototype hybrid visual style, all current tabs and panels, module toggles, and stat tracking. Ensure no functionality is lost during faction system integration.

quotes: Don't lose any features like H.E.V mark selection, etc.
Preserving Core Features: H.E.V Mark selection system (keeping all marks)

acceptanceCriteria: H.E.V Mark selector remains functional with all marks available
Mark I glitch effects still activate for Mark I suits
Prototype hybrid visual styling is preserved
All existing tabs remain accessible (Basics, Hazards, HEV, Medical, Tactical, Weapons, Utilities, Vehicles, Security, Military, Info, Settings)
Module states, stats, and backend queries continue working as before

constraints: Do not modify immutable frontend paths: useInternetIdentity.ts, useInternetIdentity.tsx, useActor.ts, main.tsx, and components/ui
Preserve all existing backend data structures and query/update functions
Keep React, Tailwind CSS, Shadcn, and React Query as the frontend stack
Maintain PWA functionality with service worker and manifest
Preserve audio system with audioBus, hevVoice, and uiSfx
Keep all existing Zustand stores for state management
nonGoals: Adding real-time multiplayer or WebSocket features
Implementing backend language changes (no Rust, JavaScript, etc.)
Adding external authentication beyond Internet Identity
Adding new frameworks or replacing existing tech stack
Creating mobile native apps (React Native, Flutter)
